byline.contributor: Majd Al Waheidi reported from Gaza, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.
byline.original: By MAJD AL WAHEIDI and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Palestinian Ishaq Khalil Hassan is killed by Egyptian border soldiers while exiting Gaza Strip and attempting to enter Egypt to seek medical treatment; incident accentuates Egypt’s strict efforts to deter terrorists, and plight of thousands of people who need healthcare or are trying to study abroad, and are waiting for Egyptian border to open.
lead_paragraph: Ishaq Khalil Hassan, 28, hoped to wade into Egypt for medical care, his family says. Naked and unarmed, he was gunned down by border guards.

headline.main: Desperate Gaza Escape Attempt Leads to Death, and Recriminations
headline.print_headline: Seeking Escape, a Gazan Finds Death

snippet: Ishaq Khalil Hassan, 28, hoped to wade into Egypt for medical care, his family says. Naked and unarmed, he was gunned down by border guards.
